> <OLD>
>
> WHEELIE paused.  This particular setup confused him a great deal.  While he
> would assume Rodimus was familiar with how an Earthern medical facility was
> setup, he would not think that the medics here who were treating him would
> have made such an exact match, or even set it up according to such
> parameters if they had no datatracts.

<NEW>

Perhaps it was some element of information had crept through into
these being's datatracks after all, or perhaps they were lying and
knew far more than they were revealing, or perhaps it was just that
they were transmetal and so were partly biological and partly metalic,
and so their rooms were a very much like a biological life's hospital
as much as they were a mechanical repair shop.

In any case the room, while superficially resembled a hospital, it is
obvious from the faint smell of lubricant and metal that no human
doctor would find this room usable as recovery chamber. The healing
tools in this room, rather than being syringes and scapels, were
instead laser cutters and wrenches, along with other assorted high
tech scanners and devices.

> <OLD>
>
> Wheelie's menaderings within his processor were cut off over by the
> gesticulations from Rodimus as he responded, "You're in bed.  You look like
> you asked Grimlock to dance on your head."

<NEW>

RODIMUS' optics brightened, "Grimlock!" he said as he swung his legs
over the side of the bed. "Did I see Grimlock?" He looked around the
room and then back at WHEELIE, it was as if he were trying to jog a
sluggish memory.

RODIMUS slid out of bed and onto his feet, he was definitly looking a
lot stronger now. He reached over trying to dislodge the final energon
drip that was still attached to him.

He shook his head, "My memory of what brought me here is kind of
fuzzy." With an almost startled look he straighted as a part of his
memory crystalized. "Have you seen Cyclonus here? He was with me when
. . . whatever happened."

(TAG)

Preston
